Class MergeSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • MergeSort

  • public class MergeSort
extends java.lang.Object
    MergeSort.java Extra Credit Project - A Battle of Sorts? ICS 311 - Suthers This class can be called statically to execute a merge sort on a String array

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MergeSort() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static void merge(java.lang.String[] arr, java.lang.String[] aux, int leftBound, int midBound, int rightBound)
      This part of the array takes the two arrays and 3 indexes which create two adjacent conceptual arrays which are considered to be sorted.
      private static void mergeSort(java.lang.String[] arr, java.lang.String[] aux, int l, int r)
      This part of the sort splits the array in half recursively down and calls merge to join everything back together up.
      static void sort(java.lang.String[] array)
      Static method that sorts the given array in place

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        public static void sort(java.lang.String[] array)
        Static method that sorts the given array in place
        Parameters:
        array - String array

      • mergeSort

        private static void mergeSort(java.lang.String[] arr,
             java.lang.String[] aux,
             int l,
             int r)
        This part of the sort splits the array in half recursively down and calls merge to join everything back together up. Entire arrays are passed, but parameters create boundaries for conceptual array, local to specific method call.
        Parameters:
        arr - String array to be sorted
        aux - String array, necessary to store data temporarily during sort
        l - leftmost index of conceptual array
        r - rightmost index of conceptual array

      • merge

        private static void merge(java.lang.String[] arr,
         java.lang.String[] aux,
         int leftBound,
         int midBound,
         int rightBound)
        This part of the array takes the two arrays and 3 indexes which create two adjacent conceptual arrays which are considered to be sorted. The two arrays are then sorted in the auxiliary array before being copied back into the original.
        Parameters:
        arr - String array to be sorted
        aux - String array, necessary to store data temporarily during sort
        leftBound - leftmost index of conceptual array #1
        midBound - rightmost index of conceptual array #1
        rightBound - rightmost index of conceptual array #2
